ca.eandb.jmist.framework.geometry

Class ConstructiveSolidGeometry

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.eandb.jmist.framework.geometry.AbstractGeometry
      • ca.eandb.jmist.framework.geometry.CompositeGeometry
        • ca.eandb.jmist.framework.geometry.ConstructiveSolidGeometry
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Bounded3, SceneElement, VisibilityFunction3, Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    IntersectionGeometry, SubtractionGeometry, UnionGeometry

    public abstract class ConstructiveSolidGeometry
extends CompositeGeometry
    An abstract SceneElement that combines other geometries using a boolean expression.
    Author:
    Brad Kimmel
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • intersect

        public void intersect(Ray3 ray,
                      IntersectionRecorder recorder)
        Description copied from interface: SceneElement
        Computes the intersections between a given ray and this geometry.
        Specified by:
        intersect in interface SceneElement
        Overrides:
        intersect in class AbstractGeometry
        Parameters:
        ray - A Ray3 to intersect with this geometry.
        recorder - An IntersectionRecorder to receive the computed intersections.

      • isInside

        protected abstract boolean isInside(int nArgs,
                                    BitSet args)
        Evaluates the boolean expression for this class of ConstructiveSolidGeometry.
        Parameters:
        nArgs - The number of child geometries.
        args - A BitSet of values indicating whether the ray is inside each of the child geometries. This argument should not be modified by the method.
        Returns:
        A value indicating whether the ray is inside the combined geometry. The result should be deterministic. That is, two calls to this method with the same value for nArgs and for args should yield the same result.
